com.camerontec.util.collection.persisted.cache

Class CompositeLRUBytesCache

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.util.collection.persisted.cache.CompositeLRUBytesCache
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BytesCache, Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public final class CompositeLRUBytesCache
extends Object
implements BytesCache
    BytesCache implementation that enforces an LRU eviction policy.
    This implementation combines an off-heap asynchronous data store (consisting of a hash map and an LRU expiration linked list) with an on-heap L1 cache. The off-heap data store gets written to asynchronously via the medium of a circular buffer. The on-heap-L1 cache is used to avoid cache misses for cached entries that are in-flight when the cache is read.
    In the majority of cases, the amount of heap memory used by the L1 cache does not exceed 5% of the total amount of memory allocated to the cache.
    When initialized, the cache calibrates its off-heap data store in order to get the best of the allocated off-heap memory. This process takes into account the expected average payload size of the cache. If actual values stored into the cache are consistently smaller or larger than the expected average payload size, the cache performs as expected but does not utilize its allocated off-heap memory as well as it could. This information is exposed via methods getSizingData() and getStatistics() which can be used at runtime to get accurate measurements of the cache's efficiency.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CompositeLRUBytesCache

        public CompositeLRUBytesCache(ILogger logger,
                              String name,
                              Path directory,
                              long capacity,
                              int averagePayloadSize,
                              boolean blocking,
                              NamedTaskExecutorService executor,
                              ICollectionRegistry collectionRegistry)
                       throws IOException
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        logger - a logger
        name - the cache's name, which is only used for logging purposes
        directory - the directory to use for cache calibration persistence
        capacity - the total amount of memory that the cache can use
        averagePayloadSize - the average size of the bytes payload stored into the cache
        blocking - controls the type of thread barrier used by the CircularBuffer's producer: if true, a BlockingBarrier is used, if false, a SpinAndYieldBarrier is used.
        executor - a NamedTaskExecutorService used to create the cache's consumer thread
        collectionRegistry - the collection registry to use for persisting calibration data to disk
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O exception occurs when writing to disk during the calibration process

        public void put(long offset,
                BytesSegment bytes)
        Description copied from interface: BytesCache
        Caches bytes for the given offset. Note that implementations do not have to guarantee to be idempotent when this method is invoked multiple times with the same arguments (which should not be required).
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        offset - an offset
        bytes - the associated bytes

      • update

        public void update(long oldOffset,
                   long newOffset,
                   BytesSegment bytes)
        Description copied from interface: BytesCache
        Updates the cache by removing bytes associated with the given old offset and caching bytes for the given new offset. Calling this method is conceptually equivalent to calling remove(oldOffset) then put(newOffset, bytes), but this composite method allows cache implementations to guarantee better performance. If the given old offset is not the offset of a cached entry, invoking this method has no effect.
        Specified by:
        update in interface BytesCache
        Parameters:
        oldOffset - the old offset
        newOffset - the new offset
        bytes - the bytes associated with the new offset
